DataElement.preferredName: Quality of Life European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer Cancer Patient Assessment Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the global health status and/or QOL score as the subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life using the European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer (EORTC) instrument.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Quality of Life European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer Cancer Patient Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life using the European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer (EORTC) cancer patient (a person who receives medical care for the purpose of treating, diagnosing or preventing cancer) instrument.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life.  The concept holds varying meanings for different people and may evolve over time. For some individuals it implies autonomy, empowerment, capability, and choice; for others, security, social integration, or freedom from stress or illness.

Concepts.definition: The subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life. The concept holds varying meanings for different people and may evolve over time. For some individuals it implies autonomy, empowerment, capability, and choice; for others, security, social integration, or freedom from stress or illness.

Property.preferredName: European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer Cancer Patient Assessment
Property.preferredDefinition: The aims of the European Organisation for Research and Treatment of Cancer (EORTC) are to conduct, develop, coordinate, and stimulate laboratory and clinical research in Europe to improve the management of cancer and related problems by increasing survival but also patients' quality of life. There are more than 60 institutions and departments that have been recognized by EORTC as affiliated. These groups conduct, on a voluntary basis, laboratory research and/or clinical trials on all types of cancers using a multidisciplinary approach. EORTC maintains close working relationship with NCI and the British Cancer Research United Kingdom in London.:A person who receives medical care for the purpose of treating, diagnosing or preventing cancer.:Having determined the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.longName: European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer
Concepts.definition: A group with aims to conduct, develop, coordinate, and stimulate laboratory and clinical research in Europe to improve the management of cancer and related problems by increasing survival but also patients' quality of life. There are more than 60 institutions and departments that have been recognized by EORTC as affiliated. These groups conduct, on a voluntary basis, laboratory research and/or clinical trials on all types of cancers using a multidisciplinary approach. EORTC maintains close working relationship with NCI and the British Cancer Research United Kingdom in London.
A person who receives medical care for the purpose of treating, diagnosing or preventing cancer.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: information on quality of patient life and ability to function

ValueDomain.preferredName: Patient Quality of Life Assessment Score
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the patient's assessment of overall quality of life.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.

Concepts.definition: The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 3 and less than 5 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of three and one.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 3 and less than 5 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of three and one.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 4 and less than 6 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of four and one.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 4 and less than 6 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of four and one.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 5 and less than 7 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of five and one.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 5 and less than 7 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of five and one.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 6 and less than 8 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of six and one.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 6 and less than 8 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of six and one.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A mathematical element that when added to another number yields the same number; the cardinal number meaning one less than one.

Concepts.definition: A mathematical element that when added to another number yields the same number; the cardinal number meaning one less than one.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 9 and less than 11 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of nine and one.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 9 and less than 11 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of nine and one.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 7 and less than 9 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of seven and one.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 7 and less than 9 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of seven and one.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 8 and less than 10 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of nine and one.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 8 and less than 10 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of nine and one.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: information on quality of patient life and ability to function

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Score; a number or letter indicating quality.

Concepts.definition: A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
